meanings.sent1: She preconditioned the oven before baking the cookies.
meanings.sent2: He always preconditioned his body with stretching before exercising.
meanings.sent3: The cat was preconditioned to expect treats whenever the doorbell rang.
meanings.sent4: His mind was preconditioned to associate the smell of coffee with waking up.
meanings.sent5: The students were preconditioned to raise their hands before speaking in class.

meanings.definition: Having been conditioned or prepared beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The preconditioned soil was perfect for planting flowers.
meanings.sent2: She bought a preconditioned car that had all the necessary upgrades.
meanings.sent3: The dog's preconditioned excitement for walks always made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His preconditioned response to stress was to take deep breaths.
meanings.sent5: The preconditioned audience erupted into applause as soon as the performance ended.
